case_vignette: a 3-year-old female presents with her mother for evaluation of a rash present for two days. mother notes the patient developed a runny nose, cough, and fever four days prior to onset of rash which began as small raised red bumps on the chest and progressively spread to arms and legs. mother denies any medication exposures or new topical products. physical examination reveals multiple juicy, monomorphic erythematous pink scattered papules on the arms, legs, buttock with sparing of the chest and back. the patient is up to date with vaccinations.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a rash that started as small raised red bumps on my chest and has spread to my arms and legs. I also had a runny nose, cough, and fever a few days before the rash began.
How old are you?
I am 3 years old.
Have you been vaccinated for measles, mumps, and rubella (MMR)?
Yes, I am up to date with my vaccinations.
Has anyone in close contact with you recently been ill or had similar symptoms?
My mother didn't mention anyone else who has been ill or had similar symptoms.
Do the bumps itch or cause any discomfort?
My mother did not mention if the bumps itch or cause any discomfort.
Final Diagnosis: Roseola
